item.title: Understanding a fair comparison between Cassandra MongoDB and MySQL üë®üèº‚Äçüíª
item.description: When choosing between Cassandra, MongoDB, and MySQL, it’s important to consider the specific requirements of your project and how each database management system (DBMS) meets those needs. Here are some points to consider when deciding which DBMS to use: ‚ûú Data model : Cassandra and MongoDB are both NoSQL databases, which means they use a non-relational data model. This can be beneficial for handling large amounts of unstructured data, or for storing data with complex relationships.
